item.description:
The Auto-Save feature allows dotCMS to automatically save any changes made to a given Contentlet by the User after X amount of seconds have passed.

The new Endpoint method created for this: **`/api/v1/_draft`** , works like this:

- If the User is working **on the live version of the current Contentlet** and make changes to it, the draft request will create a working version in order to auto-save any changes.
- When a second change is made, the draft method will re-use the previously generated Inode and will overwrite it with the new changes.
- Finally, any incoming changes will keep overwriting the previous working Inode. This way, dotCMS will overwrite one single working Inode instead of creating hundreds if not thousands of "useless" records for any change.

item.description:
This test makes sure that including Contentlets with circular dependencies inside Block Editor fields won't bring dotCMS down. For instance, if you have 3 Contenlets of type `My Content` with a Block Editor field, and they look like this:

- `Test Contentlet 1` includes `Test Contentlet 2` in the Block Editor field.
    
- `Test Contentlet 2` includes `Test Contentlet 3` in the Block Editor field.
    
- `Test Contentlet 3` includes `Test Contentlet 1` in the Block Editor field.
    

And you request the `Test Contentlet 1` data via REST, by default, dotCMS will return the information of `Test Contentlet 1` , and `Test Contentlet 2` **will ONLY include the Identifier and Language ID** of the `Test Contentlet 3` . This will prevent further recursiveness, specially in cases where there's a lot of information in the Block Editor, or if there are a lot more related contents in such a field.

item.description:
[https://github.com/dotCMS/core/issues/28785](https://github.com/dotCMS/core/issues/28785)

1. Create Content Type
2. Create a "description" field
3. Create content (page) from the content type
4. Request to the endpoint and get content
5. Check "description" field value
    

Expected:

The value of the field "description" should be the same that was set when creating the page

request.description:
### HTTP POST /api/v1/workflow/actions/default/fire/PUBLISH?indexPolicy=WAIT_FOR

Creates a test Contentlet of Rich Text Content Type that lives under the Test Parent Folder.

#### Request Body

- { "contentlets": \[ { "contentType": "webPageContent", "contentHost": "{{testParentFolderId}}", "title": "Test Contentlet in Folder", "body": "This is a test Contentlet in Folder" } \]}

The response for this request is provided as a JSON schema.

request.description:
### Search Content

This endpoint allows users to search for Contentlets of any type that live under a specific Folder.

#### Request Body

- `systemSearchableFields` (object, required): Defines the fields to be searched.
    
    - `siteId` (string): The ID of the site to search within.
        
- `page` (integer): The page number for paginated results.
    
- `perPage` (integer): The number of results to be displayed per page.
    

#### Response Body

The response will include the search results based on the specified criteria.

item.description:
This new REST Endpoint uses the `ContentSearchForm` class to allow users to retrieve content by abstracting the complexity o creting their own Lucene queries for it. It's based on the same business rules as the `Search` portlet in the back-end.

By default, the Lucene query will include all Contentlets:

- Living under system Host.
    
- Live and Working.
    
- Unarchived.
    
- Locked and Unlocked.
    

In case other business rules were missed or new ones must be included, it's very important to keep these test suite up to date with them.
